Total Fat 9g 14%
Trans Fat 0g  
Sodium 580mg 24%
Total Carbohydrates25g 8%
Dietary Fiber 1g 5%
Sugars 2g  
Protein 13g
author: Jennifer B.

description: I love Round Table Pizza, but the woman that works there is the most miserable human being I've ever come across. She works in customer service yet has no clue how treat HER CUSTOMERS! She may even find that being nice is easier than being such a rude bitch. I don't understand how management can continue to let someone like that run their business despite numerous complaints directly to Round Table Corporate.
author: Jeff P.

description: I have been a patron of the marina Round Table for many years.  This particular restaurant sets a standard for restaurant hygiene; it's employees are always washing their hands after handling money, peperoni, or anything non-food related.  The employees are the hardest working, most friendly and willing to please of any food establishment I've ever frequented.  All the ingredients are the freshest and the final product is incomparable to any pizza in the neighborhood.  My daily diet generally consists of brown rice, vegetables and chicken or tofu but I can't seem to get away from enjoying a personal pizza at least twice a week.  If you don't believe me, try it.  You too will be hooked.
author: Robert G.

description:
How is your portfolio? Strong to moderately strong? I hope so. Because you need to be financially secure to buy pizza from these guys. Two pizzas, $60??!! WTF!
F that. Plus you get my order wrong? You guys suck. Don't tell me that you "changed your Maui Zaui to have regular tomato sauce because everyone complained that the Polynesian sauce was gross and asked for regular instead." Dude, tell me that before the shit gets to my house. Don't assume that I blow tons of cash on your food all the time and study your marketing environments. I wouldn't order a specialty pizza that is double the price of a normal pizza, just to have you put normal shit on it. Plus your pizza isn't even that good. Then again I guess there are those loyal few Round Table devotees who regularly order from you. Like my Dad, he loves it, buys it all the time. Then again, he does have a secret method for picking a winning Lotto ticket 80% of the time...

Extra star for your Italian Garlic Supreme (still a rip-off).
author: Ben R.

description:
Go to the Round Table on Van Ness - they are much more professional, with better customer service, and they can actually keep their ingredients in stock.  I never actually was able to order from these guys because they didn't have the ingredients necessary to make their signature Chicken and Garlic pizza (namely chicken).  

Being able to keep your ingredients in stock should be the minimum a pizza place can do.
author: Jimmy B.

description: I order a medium King Arthur Supreme Pizza.... I must say that the pizza was freaking small.  I don't know if it is just this Round Table Pizza but when I order round table pizza in pinole their medium size isn't this small. Round table pizza is better then pizza hut or domino's. I like the taste but spending 30 dollars for an 8 slice medium pizza and 6 garlic twist is a little too much.
author: R. L.

description:
So after vowing to never again order from the RTP on Geary, but needing a comfort food fix, I decided to branch out.
I was nervous.  I was on edge.  And I still had to wait almost an hour.  Would it be cold when it arrived?  WOULD it arrive?  I had no way of knowing.  After the 45 minute mark passed, I started to worry.  I paced a little, went to the bathroom.  Were they ever coming?!
The bell rang and I ran down, completely ready to send his slow butt packing if my pizza was cold.  It was warm!  There was steam coming off of it when I opened the box and as I ate it!  I tipped him ridiculously well I was so excited!
Someone please explain to me how the RTP that is a mile and a half from my house can show up after an hour with a cold pie, and the one that's two miles away shows up (grrr, after an hour) with a nice warm one?  Maybe this delivery driver keeps them on his engine block while he drives that extra half mile.
p.s. I stupidly ordered a large because I was wallowing and then ate four pieces and wanted to die.  So if anyone wants pizza, just let me know (veggies need not apply - this has meat all over it)!!  Round Table makes the best leftover cold pizza around.
author: Jennifer D.

description: This was my first foray into Round Table Pizza. I was skeptical because it's a chain with some pretty annoying commercials, but it looks like a pizza place should. It's not cheap either, another clue that the pie might actually be decent. I mean, really, yeast, water, flour, tomato sauce & mozzarella...how much could you charge for that? You just know they're using something tasty if they are charging you double what  every other place is charging. I can't say it's my favorite pizza in town, or even in the top 5, but iffin I find myself way out this way by the Marina Green & have a hankerin for some pizza pie I'd meander back in.
author: Colleen B.

description: This Pizza is good.  I know its a chain but it is always a solid pie.  Pizza Hut and Dominoes are both garbage but Round Table is some probally the best pizza offered in the Marina area in my opinion.  Always a delight to have Round Table Pizza.
author: Harry E.

description: Call me trashy, but I am always down for Round Table compared to other pizza resturaunts in the neighborhood.  Probably a weird carry over from my childhood after-soccer pizza parties.  Although, it does seem expensive when compared to other chain pizza resturaunts.
author: Jennie J.

description: Standard pizza.  Nothing exotic.  Fast service, great for late night hunger.
author: Sean M.

description: Huge fan of Round Table Pizza.  They are always consistent and the pizzas just taste great!  Its even great the next day!
author: shaun l.

description: ok if you are dying for pizza and it is the only place around, but there is better pizza out there. Most of the time the pizza is too greasy for my friends and i. But the spices are there and the service is adequate.
author: Karen O.

description: We had the absolute worst pizza delivery experience with this Round Table Pizza. We ordered at around 6pm on a Sunday evening, and were told the standard delivery time of around one hour. It was also raining that night, so we did expect that the delivery would take a while and that was completely fine. Once an hour and a half had passed, we called to check in on our pizza. We were told that the pizza should have already arrived, and that the delivery driver was looking for the house. Thirty minutes later, the pizza still hadn't arrived and so we called again. It was at this point, a full two hours after ordering, that the Round Table Pizza employee became agitated and rude. We expected to receive an order within a reasonable manner of time, and when it became apparent that that would not be the case, expected that the Round Table employee would be able to calmly explain the situation. No apology was ever issued, and instead the employee got continuously more rude and disrespectful. By the time the pizza finally arrived, more than three hours had gone by. We were given a discount on the order, and we tipped the delivery driver generously especially given that it had taken over three hours to receive.  We were willing to give this store another chance given that it is consistent pizza, only to find out that our address was blocked from receiving delivery after the previous issue. Considering that we were the ones that received rude, abysmal service, it is completely ludicrous that we were then blocked from receiving delivery.   The fact that a store can stay in business while treating its customers this way is really quite disturbing.
author: Samantha S.

description: slow counter, confused staff and mehh, avg pizzas!
author: Gautam C.

description: My wife and I have ordered here a few times.  Delivery has always been slow (~ 1 hour), but not awfully slow until our last order.  Two hours later we received our lukewarm pizza.  This is after calling in multiple times and being assured the pizza was five minutes away (ha!).  I can understand the occasional long delivery, but 2 hours is way too long.  The added insult is the $3 delivery charge added to your bill PLUS they ask you to add your driver's tip when you place your order (aren't tips supposed to be given for good service AFTER you get your food?).  So yeah, we paid $7 for our pizza to be delivered 2 hours later.  No thank you.  I live a block from Pizza Orgasmica.  I'll just go there from now on.  Based on other reviews, this seems to be a persistent problem... it's also the reason I didn't bother to complain or ask for any partial refund.
author: John S.

description: The pizza isn't that bad. What really sucks is the service. People who work there don't seem to give a sh*t about customers returning.
author: John C.

description:
do not go or order from here
argumentative  horrible service 
wrong order  2 hr delivery time with wrong order
consistant bad service
author: thena h.

description: I grew up on this shit, so I have a biased opinion, but I have to say this is some banging pizza.  It was a Sunday night and I was in need of some serious pepperoni!!  In walks the Large Double Pepperoni for 13.99!!!  I have to say it was pretty dope!  Good work boys!
author: Pete C.

description: HORRIBLE PIZZA!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I usually love having Round Table pizza and have had it for years.  I ordered from this Round Table one time and it will be my last!  The people are extremely rude also.  I can't believe anyone can run a business like this.  They give Round Table a terrible name.  NEVER ORDER FROM THIS ROUND TABLE FIND ANOTHER......
author: Doug F.

description: My first foray into pizza in this city, and I was so pleased. It was the perfect dough/sauce/cheese mixture. There could have been a few more pieces of pepperoni - but thats just me being picky!
author: Katie G.

description: i grew up eating round table in the east bay...i like round table. i've tried to order pizza from this location several times in the past but no one answers the phone. so i gave up... until tonight when my boyfriend went on and on about how he loves round table. we ordered and the pizza came in less than a hour --- we ordered a pepperoni and personal garden. pizza was cold and there wasn't any sauce. we live less than 4 blocks away. not sure how this happens. not ordering pizza from here ever again. i've purchased frozen pizza across the street at safeway that tasted better. glad they never answered their phone.
author: jen y.

description: Good pizza, for what it is, which is your basic American style thin-crust pizza.  I haven't eaten much pizza since Ruby's in the Marina closed years ago (OMG, the best pizza ever, cornbread crust, etc etc)...so I was surprised at how expensive it is!  However, you can always go on-line and print out a coupon ($1 off a medium, $2 off a large, $3 off an extra large).  My only objection is that the pizza is EXTREMELY salty.  You don't notice it so much at the time but seriously, I have to make sure I have a quart of Gatorade on hand any time I order their pizza, because I develop a raging thirst afterward, and especially in the middle of the night I wake up with a dry mouth and have to chug Gatorade.  The service is very efficient, there's one girl in particular who seems lightning fast and it's a nice feeling knowing she's got all her marbles and is going to get it right the first time, which seems to be rare in public service these days!  The place is really clean.
author: Alexandra D.
